prior_works.title: Mean value methods in iteration
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The paper’s core stabilization mechanism—linearly interpolating iterates—maps directly to Mann/Krasnosel’skii averaged iterations for nonexpansive operators, providing the fixed‑point convergence backbone used to justify stability from interpolation.

prior_works.title: Monotone operators and the proximal point algorithm
prior_works.role: Foundational proximal point framework for monotone/variational inequality problems
prior_works.relationship_sentence: RAPP is explicitly a relaxed approximate proximal point scheme; its construction and analysis rely on the resolvent’s firm nonexpansiveness and stability guarantees pioneered by Rockafellar’s PPA.

prior_works.title: On the Douglas–Rachford splitting method and the proximal point algorithm
prior_works.role: Inexact/relaxed PPA and splitting; handling constraints and regularization
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The authors’ treatment of inexact and relaxed proximal steps and operator splitting underpins RAPP’s approximate updates and the paper’s extensions to constrained and regularized settings.

prior_works.title: Convex Analysis and Monotone Operator Theory in Hilbert Spaces
prior_works.authors: Heinz H. Bauschke, Patrick L. Combettes
prior_works.role: Comprehensive toolbox for nonexpansive/averaged operators and resolvents
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The nonexpansive/averaged operator theory, fixed‑point characterizations, and cocoercivity/monotonicity results compiled here are the mathematical machinery the paper leverages to show last‑iterate convergence from linear interpolation.

prior_works.title: The extragradient method for finding saddle points and other problems
prior_works.role: Classical stability baseline for monotone variational inequalities
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Extragradient is a two‑call stabilization benchmark; the paper positions RAPP as a 1‑SCLI alternative that achieves last‑iterate guarantees in broader (ρ‑co)monotone regimes, highlighting the benefit of interpolation over extra evaluations.

prior_works.title: Training GANs with Optimism
prior_works.authors: Constantinos Daskalakis, Andrew Ilyas, Vasilis Syrgkanis, Haoyang Zeng
prior_works.role: First‑order methods with last‑iterate guarantees in games
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Optimistic gradient variants establish last‑iterate stability in bilinear/monotone games; the present work broadens this line by achieving last‑iterate rates for 1‑SCLI via interpolation under ρ‑(co)monotonicity, even with plain GDA as the base step.

prior_works.title: Lookahead Optimizer: k steps forward, 1 step back
prior_works.authors: Michael R. Zhang, James Lucas, Geoffrey E. Hinton, Jimmy Ba
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The paper rederives Lookahead as an instance of RAPP, and proves convergence for Lookahead in cohypomonotone problems, formalizing and extending the practical stabilization intuition behind Lookahead’s linear interpolation.

synthesis_narrative:
The paper’s core insight—that linear interpolation stabilizes nonconvex–nonconcave training by inducing nonexpansive dynamics—stands on classic fixed-point and monotone operator theory. Mann’s averaged iteration provides the exact template for interpolating current parameters with an operator step so that the resulting mapping is averaged/nonexpansive, enabling robust fixed‑point convergence. Rockafellar’s proximal point algorithm contributes the structural backbone: its firmly nonexpansive resolvent ensures stability for variational inequalities, and RAPP is designed as a relaxed, approximate PPA that preserves this stability while remaining single‑call per iteration. Eckstein–Bertsekas’s analysis of inexact/relaxed PPA and splitting legitimizes approximate inner solves and facilitates the paper’s extensions to constrained and regularized problems.

Bauschke–Combettes consolidates the nonexpansive/averaged operator toolkit and monotonicity notions the authors deploy to prove last‑iterate convergence under ρ‑(co)monotone conditions—weakening requirements to ρ > −1/(2L). Against classical stabilization like Korpelevich’s extragradient—reliant on two operator evaluations—the proposed interpolation‑based design delivers a 1‑SCLI method with last‑iterate rates. On the algorithmic front, the work connects directly to practical interpolation schemes: it reinterprets and rigorously grounds the Lookahead optimizer within the RAPP framework, establishing convergence even with plain GDA in cohypomonotone regimes. Finally, in the broader context of game optimization, optimism‑based methods (e.g., Daskalakis et al.) showed last‑iterate stability in special cases; this paper advances that thread by achieving single‑call, interpolation‑driven last‑iterate guarantees under broader operator regularity, thereby unifying proximal, fixed‑point, and deep‑learning optimizer perspectives.
